DOC.brief_summary: Introduction : The Upper Airway Resistance Syndrome ( UARS ) sleep disorder characterize airway resistance breathe sleep lead arousal daytime sleepiness . There study UARS treatment gold standard treatment yet . Objective : Primary : To evaluate efficacy oral appliance improve fatigue patient UARS . Secondary : Evaluate effect treatment oral appliance ( OA ) patient UARS sleepiness , mood , cognition , quality life , metabolism autonomic nervous system . Methods : Subjects UARS ( Apnea/Hypopnea Index - AHI - ≤ 5 event per hour sleep Respiratory Disturbance Index - RDI - > 5 event per hour 30 % total sleep time inspiratory flow limitation excessive daytime somnolence and/or fatigue ) gender , body mass index ( BMI ) low 30Kg/m2 25 50 year age include . Subjects randomly distribute OA group placebo ( without treatment ) . At baseline evaluation , 6 month 1 year subject submit sleep questionnaire , physical exam , otolaryngological evaluation , baseline polysomnography , Epworth sleepiness scale , Multiple Sleep Latency Test , fatigue scale , neurocognitive testing , autonomic nervous system analysis ( heart rate variability ) metabolic evaluation . Mean standard deviation use descriptive statistical analysis normal distribution , median percentile ( 25 % , 75 % ) variables normally distribute . To compare treatment group T test ( parametric ) Mann Whitney ( non parametric ) use . For adjusted analysis , linear regression analysis use .
